greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of binary Lyndon words of length n with trace 0 and subtrace 0 over Z_2.
comment: Same as the number of binary Lyndon words of length n with trace 0 and subtrace 0 over GF(2).
link: Max Alekseyev, PARI/GP scripts for miscellaneous math problems
F. Ruskey, Binary Lyndon words with given trace and subtrace
F. Ruskey, Binary Lyndon words with given trace and subtrace over GF(2)
formula: a(2n) = A042979(2n), a(2n+1) = A042980(2n+1). This follows from Cattell et al. (see A042979), Main Theorem on p. 33 and Theorem 4 on p. 44.
example: a(6;0,0)=2 since the two binary Lyndon words of trace 0, subtrace 0 and length 6 are { 001111, 010111 }.
results.author: _Frank Ruskey_ and Nate Kube, Aug 21 2002
ext: Terms a(33) onward from _Max Alekseyev_, Apr 09 2013
